title: TastyTrade Credit Spread Strategy - Comprehensive Research Synthesis

sources.name: Julia Spina - The Unlucky Investor's Guide to Options Trading
sources.author: Julia Spina (Tastytrade Research Team)

summary: Comprehensive synthesis of TastyTrade/TastyLive credit spread methodology, validated against independent backtests. Confirms our North Star strategy alignment with minor parameter optimizations recommended.

DTE.rationale: Optimal theta decay curve, manageable gamma risk

management_rules.stop_loss: 2x credit received (optional: 4x for more wiggle room)
management_rules.rolling: Roll down and out when challenged, roll at 21 DTE if profitable

option_alpha_spy_30_delta.note: High win rate, but occasional large losses

sj_options_11_year_test.criticism: High probability trades offset by large occasional losses

portfolio_allocation.diversification: Uncorrelated assets (SPY + GLD, not SPY + QQQ)

position_sizing.principle: Allocate more to higher probability, higher reward

risk_metrics.CVaR: Conditional Value at Risk - measure tail risk beyond VaR
risk_metrics.gamma: Rate of delta change (danger zone indicator)

julia_spina_book_key_concepts.iv_edge: Implied volatility typically overstates realized volatility, giving sellers statistical edge

tom_sosnoff_philosophy.core_principle: Trade small, trade often - Law of Large Numbers
tom_sosnoff_philosophy.outlier_management: Can't predict outliers, can only manage via small size
tom_sosnoff_philosophy.survival_stats: Only 5-6% of floor traders survived long-term
failure_reasons: Failed to master risk management quickly
tom_sosnoff_philosophy.contrarian_approach: Fade trends, don't believe in trends

delta.verdict: ALIGNED - 30-delta is within range, higher premium but lower win rate

management.verdict: ALIGNED - consider adding 21 DTE exit rule

recommended_optimizations.rationale: Tastytrade standard - reduces gamma risk near expiration
recommended_optimizations.implementation: If position open at 21 DTE and profitable, close or roll

recommended_optimizations.change: Consider 16-20 delta for higher win rate
recommended_optimizations.tradeoff: Lower premium per trade, higher win rate

recommended_optimizations.rationale: Elevated IV = higher premiums, better edge
recommended_optimizations.implementation: Check IV Rank before opening new positions

why_selling_premium_works: Implied volatility typically overstates actual realized volatility
Markets price in fear (demand for protection) beyond actual risk
Premium sellers capture this 'fear premium' over time
Law of Large Numbers: many small wins offset occasional large losses
With proper sizing, 80%+ win rate is achievable with early exits
why_it_can_fail: Large outlier events (Aug 2024, Apr 2025) can wipe multiple months of gains
Position sizing too large eliminates statistical edge
Trading illiquid underlyings increases slippage and gap risk
Holding to expiration increases gamma risk and reduces win rate
Trading during low IV reduces premium collected

action_items.action: Add 21 DTE management trigger to trading system
action_items.impact: Reduces gamma risk, aligns with Tastytrade standard
Prevents over-allocation, aligns with Julia Spina guidance
May improve win rate at cost of lower premiums

action_items.action: Add IV Rank filter to entry criteria
action_items.impact: Improves premium collection, aligns with Tastytrade methodology
